title: How to Install Scripts Into Gimp

steps.title: Find the script that you want to install.
steps.content: Find the script that you want to install. GIMP scripts end with *.scm . Search for them by using terms such as, GIMP, script, scm.

steps.title: Click on the link and save the file.
steps.content: Click on the link and save the file.

steps.title: Open the file.
steps.content: Open the file. If this is the first time you are doing this, your computer probably won't know what to do with the file.

steps.title: Click on the second option, 'Select a program from a list of installed programs'.
steps.content: Click on the second option, 'Select a program from a list of installed programs'. Notepad and WordPad will do what you need it to.

steps.title: Look at the code.
steps.content: Look at the code. You don't need to do anything with it, but what you see now is the text of the code.

steps.title: Click 'Save As' and save the file.
steps.content: Click 'Save As' and save the file.

steps.title: Navigate to the script folder in your GIMP folder.
steps.content: Navigate to the script folder in your GIMP folder. In this screenshot, the path is C:\Graphics\GIMP-2.0\share\gimp\2.0\scripts This directory might have this filepath for Windows 7 users - C:\Program Files\GIMP 2\share\gimp\2.0\scripts.
